g.text: every item potentially of different type
all items of the same type
array, but size() doesn't have a value
it removes n dimensions from the structure
and then it adds n' of them back (TODO: DIMs)
Args... are indexes on the given Path...
item[x=1,y=2,z=3], where y is statically indexed
list of dimensions specific to the topmost structure
+ get_dim<DIM, [ctx]>(): Dimension object castable to bool
retrieves a dimension object which is castable to bool
[ctx] is a context which leads to the DIM (sub)dimension
doesn't have to be well-defined, but then
it has to tell us why (e.g. unsized vector dimension)
marks the ground level of the structure
Path has to make sense (it denotes dims)
a fixed dimmension (or even resizes vectors?)
cannot be array, because size is an rt variable
